intro: Manettia albert-smithii, commonly known as the Albert-Smith manettia, is a flowering plant native to western Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It prefers shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
